refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: gimp_enums_init ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gimp_enums_init (void);
refsect2.para: This function makes sure all the enum types are registered with the GObject type system. This is intended for use by language bindings that need the symbols early, before gimp_main is run. It's not necessary for plug-ins to call this directly, as the normal plug-in initialization code will handle it implicitly.

refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { GIMP_NORMAL_MODE, GIMP_DISSOLVE_MODE, GIMP_BEHIND_MODE, GIMP_MULTIPLY_MODE, GIMP_SCREEN_MODE, GIMP_OVERLAY_MODE, GIMP_DIFFERENCE_MODE, GIMP_ADDITION_MODE, GIMP_SUBTRACT_MODE, GIMP_DARKEN_ONLY_MODE, GIMP_LIGHTEN_ONLY_MODE, GIMP_HUE_MODE, GIMP_SATURATION_MODE, GIMP_COLOR_MODE, GIMP_VALUE_MODE, GIMP_DIVIDE_MODE, GIMP_DODGE_MODE, GIMP_BURN_MODE, GIMP_HARDLIGHT_MODE, GIMP_SOFTLIGHT_MODE, GIMP_GRAIN_EXTRACT_MODE, GIMP_GRAIN_MERGE_MODE, GIMP_COLOR_ERASE_MODE } GimpLayerModeEffects;

gimp_enums_get_type_names ()
refsect2.programlisting: const gchar** gimp_enums_get_type_names (gint *n_type_names);
refsect2.para: This function gives access to the list of enums registered by libgimp. The returned array is static and must not be modified.

listitem.simpara: return location for the number of names
